discussion.content: CFS uses the defaults IP multicast address of 239.255.70.83. Although this is configurable. So answer is A.

Selected Answer: A
A is correct!

questions.question_text:
//IMG//
Refer to the exhibit. Cisco Fabric Services is enabled in the network. Which type of IP address is used by the Cisco Fabric Services protocol?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
System configuration— usernames and roles
Logical configuration— service profiles
All configuration—An XML file that includes all system and logical configuration settings

I think it's some mistake in a question.
System Configuration is true for backup usernames and roles only
Full state it's a binary file, not XML
Logical Configuration is true for backup service profiles only
All Configuration do all of the above but does not include passwords for locally authenticated users in a XML file.
what did the author of this question mean?

Answer is definitely "A"

System configuration—An XML file that includes all system configuration settings such as usernames, -SURL
 roles, and locales. You can use the file generated from this backup to import these 
 configuration settings to the original fabric interconnect or to a different fabric 
 interconnect. You cannot use this file for a system restore.

comments.content: its C .. sorry for wrong ans

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
All Configuration: Logical Configuration will be an XML file of all logical configuration settings which will have service profiles related, VLANs & VSANs connectivity, pools, and policies.

Selected Answer: D
D is correct

questions.question_text: Which Cisco UCS Manager XML encoded backup type must be used to back up user names, roles, and service profiles?

What is the format of this output?

//IMG//

choices.C: Modify resource allocation with the virtual-service resize command
choices.B: Increase the compute resources with the guestshell resize command
choices.A: Edit the container properties with the guestshell run command.
choices.D: Enable the Bash shell of the switch with the feature bash command.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
If the network-admin requires additional resources for the Guest Shell, the guestshell resize {cpu | memory | rootfs} command changes these limits.
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/switches/datacenter/nexus9000/sw/7-x/programmability/guide/b_Cisco_Nexus_9000_Series_NX-OS_Programmability_Guide_7x/Guest_Shell.html#concept_7CFE594913434A16AE3BB353B314898C:~:text=If%20the%20network%2Dadmin%20requires%20additional%20resources%20for%20the%20Guest%20Shell%2C%20the%20guestshell%20resize%20%7Bcpu%20%7C%20memory%20%7C%20rootfs%7D%20command%20changes%20these%20limits.

Selected Answer: D
I believe you need admin rights to install docker 
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/switches/datacenter/nexus9000/sw/93x/progammability/guide/b-cisco-nexus-9000-series-nx-os-programmability-guide-93x/b-cisco-nexus-9000-series-nx-os-programmability-guide-93x_chapter_0100001.html#id_70954

Selected Answer: B
By default, the resources for the Guest Shell have a small impact on resources available for normal switch operations. If the network-admin requires additional resources for the Guest Shell, the guestshell resize {cpu | memory | rootfs} command changes these limits.

questions.question_text: A network administrator must create a Linux container on a Cisco Nexus Series Switch. The container requires 10 percent of the CPU of the switch and 1024 MB of RAM to run successfully. Which task provides the necessary resources?

choices.B:
switch(config)# interface Ethernet 2/1
switch(config-if)# shutdown lan
choices.D:
switch(config)# interface vfc 2
switch(config-if)# shutdown lan
choices.C:
switch(config)# interface Ethernet vfc 2
switch(config-if)# shutdown force
choices.A:
switch(config)# interface Ethernet 2/1
switch(config-if)# shutdown force

discussion.content:
The Answer is "B"

The shutdown lan command is only configurable on port-channel interfaces, FEX HIF ports, or on individual Ethernet interfaces that vFC interfaces are bound upon.

The shutdown lan command is only configurable on port-channel interfaces or on individual Ethernet interfaces that are in an operational trunking state.

The shutdown lan command cannot be enabled on the secondary vPC leg, if the vPC enabled shutdown lan is applied on the secondary vPC leg.
xamples of Shutdown LAN Traffic

 Shutdown the LAN traffic on port-channel.


 switch(config)#interface port-channel 955
 switch(config-if)# shutdown lan

 Shutdown the LAN traffic on individual Ethernet port.


 switch(config)#interface Ethernet 2/5
 switch(config-if)# shutdown lan

questions.question_text: A network engineer connects the CNA interface of a server to a switch. The switch must bring down all of the VLANs on the interface that are not enabled for FCoE, but the VLANs that are enabled for FCoE should continue to carry SAN traffic without interruption. Which configuration should be applied to the switch to achieve this objective?
